visualization_prompt: Generate a packedbubble chart showing product category performance metrics using size-encoded quantitative values with categorical grouping
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains univariate quantitative measurements across six categorical product groups. Synthetic sales figures follow exponential distribution (μ=748, σ=1167) with intentional right skew to reflect typical retail performance patterns. Values maintain domain validity through constrained ranges (1-3000 units) and logical category relationships. The packed bubble visualization maximizes data-ink ratio by encoding both quantitative (size) and categorical (color gradient) dimensions in single visual marks. Perceptual effectiveness is achieved through: 1) Monochromatic color progression maintaining Cairo's principle of discriminability, 2) Size scaling proportional to square root of values (max bubble area ≈ 200x min), and 3) Direct labeling avoiding legend dependencies. Extreme value (Electronics at 3000) creates natural visual hierarchy while secondary bubbles reveal mid-range performance clusters.
